授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to understand the role that resource exporting industries have played in the evolution of the Canadian economic system.
到達目標: The students will learn about the crucial role that resource exporting industries have played in Canadian economic history. Students will be familiarized with Harold Innis’ staples theory as a model for explaining the evolutionary pattern of Canadian political economy. Students will explore examples of several key staple industries, from the fur trade to the oil sands.
授業の概要・背景: The course will cover topics about Canadian resource industries and their associated communities. The course will primarily involve lectures with some student discussion.
